message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product at a special price of $180. It's a great deal, and I think you'll love it!
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $140. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I have to make a living. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make at least $160. Can you consider that?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $160 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $145 for the product. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal. I can see you're serious about getting a good price, so I'm willing to make a small concession. I can do $155, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, but $155 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $150 for the product, which is the same price I could get from John. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I've already mentioned that I can sell the product to John for $150, and I'm not willing to go any lower than that. I'm willing to make one final offer to you, but I need to make a profit. I can do $157.50. That's as low as I can go.
I've already offered you $150, and you've rejected it. I'm not willing to pay more than that. I'm going to have to consider buying the product from John for $150.
